11:16 <vmassol> good morning  
11:16 <vmassol> new blog post: http://massol.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/JenkinsGitHubOrganization  
11:16 <vmassol> note/idea: we could share it on xwiki.org too  
11:50 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <ol-ow2> Hi ! this $doc.display($propertyName, 'edit' ) render to me {{html}}<the input field/>{{/html}} how to avoid this {{html}} macro, but just the html content ? tmortagne vmassol  
13:06 <vmassol> has quit  
13:10 <lynxt> has quit  
13:11 <tillo> has quit  
13:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <Pbas> Hi ol-ow2, http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/APIGuide#HAccessobjectsinapage ?  
14:03 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:05 <vmassol> ol-ow2: display is meant to do this :)  
14:05 <vmassol> if you want the raw value  
14:05 <vmassol> you can use $doc.getValue('xpropertyname')  
14:06 <ol-ow2> nop :)  
14:07 <ol-ow2> to get that i want i'm currently using : $doc.display($propertyName,'edit','prefix\_',$object).replaceAll('(\{\{(|\/)html(.\*?)\}\})','')) vmassol Pbas  
14:07 <vmassol> well you're not supposed to do that  
14:07 <vmassol> $doc.display will return wiki syntax  
14:07 <ol-ow2> i need to get the field, not the value  
14:08 <ol-ow2> llike as <input size='30' id='prefix\_Main.theClass\_0\_first\_name' value='' name='prefix\_Main.theClass\_0\_first\_name' type='text'/>  
14:09 <vmassol> yes but it's not meant to do that  
14:09 <vmassol> why do you need that?  
14:09 <ol-ow2> intead {{html ..}}<input..>{{/html}}  
14:09 <vmassol> tell us your use case instead of your solution :)  
14:10 <ol-ow2> i need that because i would like create a form including any class which contains fields  
14:10 <vmassol> xwiki doesn't support forms  
14:10 <vmassol> so you don't create forms  
14:10 <ol-ow2> and use $docToSave.addObjectFromRequest($classes.name)  
14:11 <vmassol> you create HTML conent representing a form inside a {{html}} macro  
14:12 <vmassol> BTW the fact that {{html}} is added depends on the renering content  
14:12 <vmassol> \*context  
14:12 <vmassol> \*rendering  
14:12 <vmassol> the code is here is you're interested: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/b8f0da1b63ba629a0e91fbfbeb96c0db62f64cb7/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java#L3316-L3316  
14:17 <Pbas> This one maybe: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/APIGuide#HAccessobjectsfromanypageandloopoverallobjectsofsameClass to list all objects (and get name + value) ?  
14:21 <ol-ow2> FYI: http://pastebin.com/qBuAm8FE to understand what i'm doing (a n object which constains several field is added to this script page)  
14:21 <ol-ow2> (i'm looking your git links  
14:23 <ol-ow2> also: display(String fieldname, String type, Object obj, String wrappingSyntaxId)  
14:23 <ol-ow2>           Displays the given field of the given object using the given mode and syntax rendering The display mode will be decided depending on page context (edit or inline context will display in edit, view context in view) This function can return html inside and html macro  
14:23 <ol-ow2> i would like just avoid that this function return html macro  
14:23 <ol-ow2> continue to look github ;)  
14:25 <vmassol> note that I guess you could also use : {{html clean=false wiki=true}}  
14:26 <ol-ow2> Ho !  
14:27 <ol-ow2> :o  
14:27 <ol-ow2> it's just awesome :D  
14:29 <ol-ow2> thx vmassol :D  
14:29 <lynxt\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <vmassol> np  
14:29 <ol-ow2> ;)  
14:30 <vmassol> not perfect but will work  
14:30 <tillo\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <ol-ow2> indeed yes, but ... i'm not a dev :D  
14:30 <ol-ow2> i mean pro  
14:32 <lynxt> has quit  
14:32 <lynxt\_> is now known as <lynxt>  
14:32 <tillo> has quit  
14:32 <tillo\_> is now known as <tillo>  
14:34 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <vmassol> I meant the fact that this will result in several html macros executed - this is the not optimal thing. But right now I don't another solution for you  
14:46 <dj\_xatra> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <ol-ow2> np , do you think wiki=true instead my regex is the best soluce ?  
14:47 <ol-ow2> in both case, that's work  
14:51 <vmassol> yes. its better :)  
14:51 <vmassol> (the regex is really ugly :))  
14:51 <vmassol> and fragile  
14:51 <ol-ow2> ok ;)  
14:51 <dj\_xatra> I'm trying to write a velocity script that lists all pages in a space recursively. I found that $xwiki.searchDocuments("where doc.space = ?", [$my\_space]) gets me a list of the top level pages. How do I get the deeper levels?  
14:52 <dj\_xatra> XWiki v7.4.5  
14:56 <tmortagne> dj\_xatra: looks like there is an example of what you are asking at the end of the table in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module#HQueryLanguageExamples  
14:56 <ol-ow2> searchDocuments isn't deprecated ? http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module  
14:56 <ol-ow2> lol same link  
14:56 <vmassol> was going to say that too :)  
14:56 <tmortagne> yes it is  
14:57 <vmassol> I added these examples recently http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module?viewer=changes&rev1=33.1&rev2=35.3 :)  
14:58 <tmortagne> dj\_xatra: as indicated by ol-ow2 you should also take a look at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module#HFromVelocity which is the "new" (starting to be a old "new") API to to database queries  
15:02 <dj\_xatra> thanks, hadn't thought of just using 'like'.  
15:02 <dj\_xatra> I thought I would need to query for the subspaces first  
15:19 <ol-ow2> dj\_xatra: look at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module  => List the nested documents that contain 'wiki' in their name (7.2+)  
15:19 <ol-ow2> space & parent spaces  
15:32 <dj\_xatra> ol-ow2: that last one fails to execute, HQL as well as XWQL. I'm gonna sleep on it and try again tomorrow.  
15:35 <vmassol> dj\_xatra:  
15:35 <vmassol> you have the right XWiki version?  
15:35 <ol-ow2> 7.4.5 he said  
15:35 <vmassol> should work indeed  
15:37 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <dj\_xatra> I already closed the page. Something about "expected ',' or ')' at XWikiSpace position.  
15:37 <dj\_xatra> Will try again tomorrow.  
15:38 <dj\_xatra> Hm, I have a day off. Next week then. :)  
15:38 <vmassol> lucky you :)  
15:38 <dj\_xatra> Going to FOSDEM, no less. \o/  
15:38 <vmassol> ah cool  
15:39 <vmassol> xwiki has a stand there  
15:39 <vmassol> I hope you'll come and meet us!  
15:39 <dj\_xatra> Will there be swag? :)  
15:39 <vmassol> there'll be about 4-5 xwiki devs  
15:39 <vmassol> not sure what you mean; they're all swag ofc :)  
15:40 <ol-ow2> i'll be not to fosdem, but a part of OW2 team will :D  
15:41 <dj\_xatra> My colleagues aren't going but they're asking me to bring back free stuff with logos so they can pretend that they were there. :)  
15:41 <vmassol> we have nice xwiki stickers  
15:41 <vmassol> among other things  
15:41 <ol-ow2> in fact i'm not sure ... anyway have a good time to fosdem  
15:43 <dj\_xatra> Well, still gotta work out my planning. I want to see around 376 talks and meet 52 people. :p  
15:43 <vmassol> dj\_xatra: nice challenge :)  
15:46 <dj\_xatra> Gotta go. See you there.  
15:47 <dj\_xatra> has quit  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:55 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki

16:27 <ol-ow2> in edit class mode, i'm using a STATIC LIST,   as radio button,  in value i would like put something like that ${escapetool.xml($services.localization.render('value1'))}instead of raw text , how can i do that ? vmassol tmortagne
